meanings.definition: A tool with a handle and a broad scoop or blade for digging and moving material.
meanings.sent1: Dad used a shovel to dig a hole for the new plant.
meanings.sent2: The gardener grabbed a shovel to plant the flowers.
meanings.sent3: The shovel leaned against the shed, tired from all the digging.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a shovel, unearthing buried emotions.
meanings.sent5: The shiny shovel gleamed in the sunlight as it dug into the earth.

meanings.definition: To lift and throw material with a shovel.
meanings.sent1: I shovel snow off the driveway every winter.
meanings.sent2: She had to shovel coal into the furnace to keep the house warm.
meanings.sent3: He tried to shovel sand into the bucket, but most of it ended up on the ground.
meanings.sent4: The chef would shovel ingredients into the pot, creating a delicious stew.
meanings.sent5: The workers shovel dirt into the truck, preparing for construction.

meanings.sent1: We shovel all day to finish the job on time.
meanings.sent2: The students had to shovel through their assignments to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: She would shovel through paperwork, determined to find the missing document.
meanings.sent4: The team had to shovel through the dense forest to reach the campsite.
meanings.sent5: He shoveled through the cluttered garage, searching for his old tools.
